alert.note: Alert for Bell; Harlan; Knox; Leslie (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 9:26PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan, northeastern Bell, northeastern Knox and southwestern Leslie Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 926 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Erose, or 12 miles north of Pineville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beverly and Sandy Fork around 930 PM EDT. Walker and Dewitt around 935 PM EDT. Field around 940 PM EDT. Saylor around 945 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Rella, Blanche, Stony Fork Junction, Tacky Town, Arjay, Cary, Pineville, Callaway, Kettle Island, Miracle, Blackmont, Balkan, Varilla, Black Snake, Molus and Straight Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
